msItem.title: Common-place book of John Curteys of Winchester College and New College, Oxford
msItem.note: The collector and chief writer was apparently John Curteys, for the writer was born Nov. 12, 1457; entered Winchester College Apr. 23, 1469; entered New College, Oxford, June 29, 1474 (see fol. 121v); and was apparently a Fellow of New College and of Winchester: Curteys died in 1509. A full list of contents is printed in the Old Catalogue of 1697, see also foll. 1 and (in alphabetical order) iii-v, in the present manuscript. Among the more important items are:
(fol. vi, 3, 36). Notes about England, e.g. church revenues, numbers of churches, shires, etc.
(foll. 2, 106, cf. 79v) Short Latin chronicles of England, 1422-1509, ('Opinio vulgaris') and 1066-1447

(fol. 3v, cf. 11v) a short general Latin chronicle, with some special references to Dominicans, to 1286, partly ('Aetates mundi') 'ex tabula Cronicarum cathedrali ecclesia (sic) Lincolnie', and at fol. 6 a note on Friday
(foll. 5, 17v, 25v, 29v) Short Latin poems and proverbs, one poem on fol. 5 beg. 'Tot video gentes', another on fol. 19v 'Exiit edictum ab Augusto Caesare'
(foll. 9v, 27v) 'De Joanne Potadwe' archbp. of Armenia, who came to England in 1228 with tidings of the Wandering Jew
(fol. 15) 'Problemata Secundi philosophi'
(fol. 21) Latin note of a yearly indulgence at Eton
(fol. 22) Extracts 'Ex prologo [Gulielmi] Notyngham de concordia'
(fol. 39) Computus ecclesiasticus manualis (beg. 'Filius esto Dei'), with prose commentary
(fol. 51v) Latin note on the death of King Richard i
(fol. 53) the Ars Minor of Donatus, here anonymous, cf. fol. 80v
(fol. 60v) 'Vaticinium Johannis Brydlyngtone' in Latin verse (beg. 'Febribus infectus')
(fol. 66) 'Ludus scaccorum' in Latin verse (beg. 'Si ic [i. e. Sic?] fit famosa sine sanguine pugna iocosa')
(fol. 69) 'Pronostica' astrologica
(fol. 73) 'The way to Rome thorow France', an itinerary
(foll. 75, 87) Calendarial notes, in English
(fol. 83) Tractatus de generatione hominis (beg. 'Homo inter omnia animalia')
(fol. 87v) 'Colores versuum' or De modis xxx versificandi (beg. 'Primus color quo moderni versiste vtuntur')
(fol. 91) 'Omnia vtilia ad arma pertinencia', a heraldic manual: beg. 'Here begynth a scorth [i.e. short] informacon of armis, how that...'
(fol. 95) Statuta universitatis Oxoniensis, a copy of some early statutes, including the Statuta Aularia (fol. 105)

(fol. 115) 'Testamentum ... domini Willelmi de Wykeham olim episcopi Wyntoniensis ...', followed at fol. 121 by 'Cursus vite et actorum ... ' ejusdem, a short Latin biography (beg. 'Natus est anno Domini 1334'), ending with statistics about Winchester and New College admissions 1394-1431, written in 1497
: and s are printed from this MS. in Hearne's ed. of Leland's Itinerary, 1711, vol. iii, pp. 105, 154.

history.provenance: 'John Smyth Roberte Sylvest[er?] hys grandfather Elyn Sylvest[er?] late wyff of Sir[?] Edwarde Spenlowe,' early 16th cent.
